title: Good Woodworking - September 2014 (gnv64)
description:
Good Woodworking - September 2014
English | PDF | 92 pages | 54.4 mb

On the cover

Dave Roberts ventures into the City to see how Workshop East is setting up its own co-op

Michael Huntley introduces a basic lapanese pullsaw as he cuts simple carcase joints

A machine programming error could have cost Mark Gould wasted boards...

Bookrack 42
Jeff Gorman gets out his panel saw and a spokeshave to progress his bookrack
Office desk 52
Mark Gould finds himself solving a few problems on this first major commission
Bird in the hand 58
Peter Berry uses knives and chisels to carve a freeform bird from imagination
Folding table 74
Phil Davy gets ready for autumn sunshine with this portable garden table
Brown oak handicap 80
Les Thorne wet-turns a bowl from an oak that fell on his golf course
Toddler safe 89
How to take off sharp corners and shorten a table

Techniques

Andy is impressed with this guide rail system	
Hatchet job	29

Footsore	34
Repacing bracket feet can be hare work cautions Stephen Simmons
Woodwork foundations    38
Michael Huntley starts his jointing with rub joints for a tool box
Handtool precision    42
Jeff Gorman removes the toe of a bull-nose rebate plane to use it as a chisel plane

People & places
Centrefold    46
Andrea Hargreaves picks her winning furniture school exhibiting at this year's New Designers...
Best of the rest    48
... and is stunned by the sheer variety and ingenuity of 2014's crop of talented graduates
Way to go?    62
Has Dave Roberts discovered a new way of working? He meets a group who graduated last year
